alert.note: Alert for Atchison (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 7:23AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Atchison County through 800 AM CDT... At 723 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whiting, or near Holton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Effingham, Lancaster, Muscotah, Farmington, Huron and Arrington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
